sections.heading: Filing a GST Return
content: Every taxpayer who is registered for GST must file a GST return. The kind of GST return you need to file depends on the type of business you run, how much money you make, and what kind of registration you have. Filing on time makes sure you follow the rules, avoids fines, and lets the Input Tax Credit (ITC) flow smoothly.

sections.heading: When and how to use GST Return Forms

list.title: GSTR-1: Sales of Goods and Services
points: Who this applies to: Regular taxpayers
All registered businesses have a turnover.
Filing Frequency: Monthly or Quarterly (QRMP if turnover ≤ ₹5 Cr)
Date Due: Every month, on the 11th of the next month; Every three months, on the 13th of the month after the quarter

list.title: GSTR-3B: Summary Return and Payment of Taxes
points: Who this applies to: Regular taxpayers
Filing Frequency: Once a month or once every three months (QRMP ≤ ₹5 Cr)
Date Due: Every month, on the 20th of the next month; QRMP: 22nd to 24th (by state)

list.title: GSTR-4: Return for the Composition Scheme
points: For: Composition dealers
Traders and manufacturers: up to ₹1.5 Cr; Service Providers: Up to ₹50 Lakhs
Every year, you must file.
Due Date: April 30 of the next financial year

list.title: GSTR-5: Taxable Person Who Is Not a Resident
points: For: Businesses that aren't based in India but do business there
Turnover: No limit
Due date: 20th of next month

list.title: GSTR-6: Input Service Distributor (ISD)
points: For: ISD-registered businesses
Due date: 13th of next month

list.title: GSTR-7: TDS Return
points: Who can use this: Businesses that deduct TDS under GST
Due date: 10th of next month

list.title: GSTR-8—TCS Return
points: Who it applies to: People who run e-commerce sites
Due date: 10th of next month

list.title: GSTR-9—Annual Return
points: Who it applies to: Regular taxpayers
Due date: December 31 of the next fiscal year

list.title: GSTR-9A: Annual Return for Composition Dealers
points: For: People who pay composition taxes
Due date: December 31

list.title: GSTR-10: Final Return
points: If you cancel or give up your GST registration, this applies to you
Due Date: 3 months after cancellation

list.title: GSTR-11 – People with UINs
points: Who it applies to: Embassies, UN bodies, and people who have been notified
Goal: Get back the GST you paid
Due date: 28th of next month

list.title: GSTR-1 and GSTR-3B: Late Fees
points: ₹50 a day (₹25 CGST and ₹25 SGST)
₹20 a day for no return
Maximum: ₹5,000 for each return

list.title: GSTR-9 (Annual Return) Late Fees
points: ₹200 every day (₹100 for CGST and ₹100 for SGST)
Maximum: 0.5% of the state's total sales

list.title: Interest on Taxes Paid Late
points: 18% per year in unpaid taxes

sections.heading: Importance of Filing GST
content: Stay away from fines and interest.
Make sure that ITC never stops.
Cut down on mistakes and departmental notices.
